de.fhpotsdam.io.csv
Class CsvP5

java.lang.Object
  de.fhpotsdam.io.csv.CsvP5

public class CsvP5
extends Object

CsvP5 based on Ben Fry's Visualizing Data Book

Author:
Tim Pulver, Paul Vollmer
+Example
/**
 * csvP5simple
 *
 * csvP5 http://www.github.com/wrongentertainment/csvP5
 */

import de.fhpotsdam.io.csv.*;

CsvP5 csv;


void setup() {
  size(500, 500);
  
  csv = new CsvP5(this, "sample.csv");
  csv.load();
  csv.hasHeadline(false);
  println("csv total columns   =   " + csv.getColumnCount());
  println("csv total rows      =   " + csv.getRowCount());
  
  PFont font = createFont("", 12);
  textFont(font);
}


void draw() {
  background(255);
  
  for(int col=0; col

Constructor Detail

CsvP5

public CsvP5(PApplet p)
Constructor with least arguments, use this if your csv-file uses commas as separator and '#' for comments.

Parameters:
p - Use "this" from within your Processing main sketch

CsvP5

public CsvP5(PApplet p,
             String filename)
Constructor with least arguments, use this if your csv-file uses commas as separator and '#' for comments.

Parameters:
p - Use "this" from within your Processing main sketch
filename - Filename of a csv-file in your data-folder e.g. "awesome_data.csv"

CsvP5

public CsvP5(PApplet p,
             String filename,
             String separator)
Constructor with additional separator argument, use this if your csv-file not uses commas as separators.

Parameters:
p - Use "this" from within your Processing main sketch
filename - Filename of a csv-file in your data-folder e.g. "awesome_data.csv"
separator - The character/string to use as separator e.g. ";" or "\t" (Tab)

CsvP5

public CsvP5(PApplet p,
             String filename,
             String separator,
             boolean removeEnclosingQuotationMarks)
Constructor with additional separator and quotation-mark arguments, use this if your csv-file not uses commas as separators and has encolsing quotation marks e.g. "data1";"data2",...

Parameters:
p - Use "this" from within your Processing main sketch
filename - Filename of a csv-file in your data-folder e.g. "awesome_data.csv"
separator - The character/string to use as separator e.g. ";" or "\t" (Tab)
removeEnclosingQuotationMarks - If the data fields are surrounded by enclosing quotation marks (e.g. "data1";"data2"), pass true here.

CsvP5

public CsvP5(PApplet p,
             String filename,
             String separator,
             String comment,
             boolean removeEnclosingQuotationMarks)
Constructor with additional separator, comment character and quotation-mark arguments, use this if your csv-file not uses commas as separators and not uses '#' as comment indicators.

Parameters:
p - Use "this" from within your Processing main sketch
filename - Filename of a csv-file in your data-folder e.g. "awesome_data.csv"
separator - The character/string to use as separator e.g. ";" or "\t" (Tab)
comment - The character/string which is used to introduce comments
removeEnclosingQuotationMarks - If the data fields are surrounded by enclosing quotation marks (e.g. "data1";"data2"), pass true here.
Method Detail

load

public void load(String filename)
Resets the processing-flags and starts the actual CSV-processing.

Parameters:
filename - The csv filepath.

load

public void load()
Resets the processing-flags and starts the actual CSV-processing.

hasHeadline

public void hasHeadline(boolean b)
Has to be called if your CSV-file has a headline. Default is no headline.

Parameters:
b - True, if is has a headline, false otherwise

isComplete

public boolean isComplete()
Returns true, if there were no problems parsing the file.

Returns:

firstIncompleteLine

public int firstIncompleteLine()
If isComplete() returns true, which means, there were errors parsing the CSV-file, this will return the first line with parsing-errors.

Returns:
The first problematic line.

getRowCount

public int getRowCount()
Returns the number of rows. If the document has headlines and hasHeadlines(true) has been called before CSV-import, this will not contain the headline.

Returns:
rowCount Number of rows (without headline)

getColumnCount

public int getColumnCount()
Returns the number of columns.

Returns:
columnCount Number of columns

getColumnIndex

public int getColumnIndex(String name)
Returns a column index by its name, returns -1 if no column has been found. This can be used to find out a column index of a certain CSV-headline. Note, that this does not take care of the fact, that there can be more than one headlines with the same name.

Parameters:
name - name of the column
Returns:
integer index value of the column

getHeadlineName

public String getHeadlineName(int column)
Returns the name of a headline. To get the first headline, pass 0.

Parameters:
column - the Column number, which name you want to know
Returns:
String The column name (headline)

getString

                        int columnIndex)
Returns the String of a specific row and column (untouched from the CSV-file).

Parameters:
rowIndex - Row number
columnIndex - Column number
Returns:
String The data field as String
